segments.text: Sarah . You look terrible . What's wrong ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm so sorry to hear that . When did this happen ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: A couple of days ago . I just go back from the funeral .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is there anything I can do ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No ... not really . The sad thing is that I wasn't there when she died . I really wanted to be there one last time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm sure she knew you loved her . Did she pass away in the hospital ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah . She died in her sleep .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think your grandmother would want you to think of all the good times you spent together .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know . But I miss her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When my grandmother passed away , I frequently visited her in the cemetery . I always talked to her . Even though she wasn't there , I somehow knew she heard what I said .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah ? That's what I was thinking too . Thanks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It looks like you haven't eaten anything all day . We should get you something to eat .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're right ... I should eat something . Let's go .
segments.speaker: S2
